attributes.action: Stop shops preloading Microsoft Windows/Office - give consumers a choice
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Consumers used to have a huge choice of computer hardware and software but now the choice is:

a) PC compatible pre-loaded with Microsoft Windows and Office

b) Apple Mac with OS/X and Microsoft Office

What about alternatives such as Linux, BSD-Unix and OpenSolaris and other office suites such as OpenOffice, StarOffice, Google Docs (etc)?

Why should my new PC have to be pre-loaded with Microsoft software?  
What if I want to use Ubuntu Linux and OpenOffice instead?

If consumers knew about alternatives they could save lots of money and have virus free PCs.

I am not anti-Microsoft but I am pro-choice.
This should be referred to the Competition Commission.
Shops should be forced to:

* Stop pre-loading Windows/Office - offer customers a choice on every PC

* Have equivalent PCs running Windows, Linux, BSD-Unix, OpenSolaris in the shop

* Have leaflets/documentation showing the relative merits of each operating system

* Make staff demonstrate PCs running all operating systems not just Windows

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
